title: How to Open a Video_TS File on Android

steps.title: Open the Google Play Store app.
steps.content: Open the Google Play Store app. You can find this app on your home screen, in the app drawer, or by searching. You will be presented with the Home screen of the Play Store and lists of apps based on your activity.

steps.title: Type in “MoboPlayer” into the search bar.
steps.content: Type in “MoboPlayer” into the search bar. It's at the top of the screen. A list of search results will appear.

steps.title: Tap MoboPlayer in the search results.
steps.content: Tap MoboPlayer in the search results. It's the green-and-white icon containing a circle with a triangle/play button inside. The application’s author is Euphemia.

steps.title: Tap the green Install button.
steps.content: Tap the green Install button. MoboPlayer will now download to your Android. When the download is complete, the app's icon will be added to the app drawer.

steps.title: Open MoboPlayer.
steps.content: Open MoboPlayer. The app icon looks like a green play button inside a white circle. You can find this app on your home screen, in the app drawer, or by searching. If it's your first time opening the app, you'll need to give it permission to access your phone or tablet's storage.

steps.title: Tap Folder.
steps.content: Tap Folder . You’ll find this in the top menu of the app. All your device’s local folders will appear.

steps.title: Tap the Video_TS folder.
steps.content: Tap the Video_TS folder. MoboPlayer will recognize the folder as a movie and start playing it. Along the bottom of the video are icons where you can further customize your watching experience. You can change the scale of your video, take a screenshot, or make a GIF or video of the movie you’re watching.

steps.title: Go to https://handbrake.fr in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://handbrake.fr in a web browser. This brings you to the website of HandBrake, a free video conversion app that allows you to convert the files in a Video_TS folder to a format your Android can play.

steps.title: Click the red Download button.
steps.content: Click the red Download button. The HandBrake installer should automatically download the correct version for your operating system. If the download doesn't start automatically, select a download location and click Save or OK to begin. If the website cannot recognize your operating system, click Other Platforms to select the right file.

steps.title: Install HandBrake on your computer.
steps.content: Install HandBrake on your computer. Double-click the installer file you downloaded, and then follow the on-screen instructions to install the app.

steps.title: Open HandBrake.
steps.content: Open HandBrake. You can find this in your Start Menu or in your Applications folder. Upon startup, the program should prompt you to open a source.

steps.title: Click the Open Source icon.
steps.content: Click the Open Source icon. You'll find this in the left side of the toolbar that’s along the top of the program window. Your file browser will pop up. You can also drag and drop files within the Video_TS folder into the main window of HandBrake.

steps.title: Navigate to your Video_TS folder and click Select Folder.
steps.content: Navigate to your Video_TS folder and click Select Folder . Once the upload is complete, you will see your Video_TS folder with conversion options.

steps.title: Select .mp4.
steps.content: Select .mp4 . You'll find it under the "Output Settings" or "Format" header. This ensures that you're converting the movie to a high-quality file your Android can open.

steps.title: Click the green Start button.
steps.content: Click the green Start button. It's in the top toolbar next to "Source." This starts converting the Video_TS file to an .mp4.

steps.title: Move the finished file to your Android.
steps.content: Move the finished file to your Android. Now that you have an .mp4 of your movie, you can watch it in your Android's default video player. If you're not sure how to move the file to your Android, see How to Get Files from Your Computer to Android.

steps.title: Tap the .mp4 file on your Android.
steps.content: Tap the .mp4 file on your Android. Tapping on the file will load the movie in your Android's default video player.

steps.title: Go to the EaseFab Video Converter Ultimate site.
steps.content: Go to the EaseFab Video Converter Ultimate site . Although much of the site refers to Galaxy phones and tablets, EaseFab is a video conversion app that can convert video for all Androids. The free version of the app will convert 3 minutes of video per file to a format your phone can access. If your video is longer than 3 minutes, you can either pay for an upgrade or try another method.

steps.title: Click Free Download for your OS Windows or Mac.
steps.content: Click Free Download for your OS Windows or Mac. You’ll see this below the paragraphs of text. This downloads the installation file to your computer. If the download doesn't start automatically, you may have to click OK or Save to begin.

steps.title: Install EaseFab on your computer.
steps.content: Install EaseFab on your computer. To do so, double-click the installer you downloaded, and then follow the on-screen instructions.

steps.title: Open EaseFab Video Converter.
steps.content: Open EaseFab Video Converter. You’ll find this in your Start Menu or in your Applications folder.

steps.title: Click the icon of film with a green plus (+) sign.
steps.content: Click the icon of film with a green plus (+) sign. A panel will side from the side like a file browser. You can also drag and drop your files into the load panel.

steps.title: Select the Video_TS folder you want to convert.
steps.content: Select the Video_TS folder you want to convert. The folder is loaded into the program.

steps.title: Click Profile.
steps.content: Click Profile . You can find this below where your files are displayed.

steps.title: Select .mp4 from the drop-down list.
steps.content: Select .mp4 from the drop-down list. You can choose an alternate format if you wish, but make sure it's supported by your Android's default video player. MP4 is a high-quality file that you should be able to open with any video app.

steps.title: Click Convert.
steps.content: Click Convert . You’ll see a progress bar as your folder converts to a video file.

steps.title: Move the finished file to your Android.
steps.content: Move the finished file to your Android. Now that you have an .mp4 of your movie, you can watch it in your Android's default video player. If you're not sure how to move the file to your Android, see How to Get Files from Your Computer to Android.

steps.title: Tap the .mp4 file on your Android.
steps.content: Tap the .mp4 file on your Android. Tapping on the file will load the movie in your Android's default video player.
